ACHIEVE.Definition: to succeed in finishing something or reaching an aim, especially after a lot of work or effort

ALIGNED.Definition: to put two or more things into a straight line

ALLOCATED.Definition: to give something to someone as their share of a total amount, to use in a particular way

AT THE HANDS OF.Definition: If you suffer at the hands of someone, they hurt you or treat you badly

BULLIED.Definition: someone who hurts or frightens someone else, often over a period of time, and often forcing them to do something that they do not want to do

BUREAUCRACY.Definition: a system for controlling or managing a country, company, or organisation that is operated by a large number of officials employed to follow rules carefully

BUREAUCRATIC.Definition: relating to a system of controlling or managing a country, company, or organisation that is operated by a large number of officials

CERTIFICATION.Definition: the process of earning an official document, or the act of providing an official document, as proof that something has happened or been done

COFFEE LABEL.Definition: a brand or type of coffee

COMMON.Definition: the same in a lot of places or for a lot of people

CONJURE UP.Definition: to make a picture or idea appear in someone's mind

COOPERATIVE.Definition: a company owned and managed by the people who work in it

COOPERATIVES.Definition: a company owned and managed by the people who work in it

CRITICS.Definition: someone who says that they do not approve of someone or something

ETHICAL.Definition: a system of accepted beliefs that control behaviour, especially such a system based on morals

EXPLOITATION.Definition: the use of something in order to get an advantage from it

FAIR SHARE.Definition: a lot, or more than enough, of something bad

FEEL-GOOD.Definition: causing happy and positive feelings about life

FLUCTUATIONS.Definition: a change, or the process of changing, especially continuously between one level or thing and another

HOVERING.Definition: to stay in one place in the air, usually by moving the wings quickly; to stay at or near a particular level

IN-HOUSE.Definition: Something that is done in-house is done within an organisation or business by its employees rather than by other people

INCENTIVE.Definition: something that encourages a person to do something

INCENTIVES.Definition: something that encourages a person to do something

INEFFICIENCIES.Definition: a lack of organisation or skill that wastes time, energy, money, etc., or methods or actions that waste time, etc. in this way

INEVITABILITY.Definition: the fact of being certain to happen and unable to be avoided or prevented

INSTANCES.Definition: a particular situation, event, or fact, especially an example of something that happens generally

LABEL.Definition: a piece of paper or other material that gives you information about the object it is attached to

LACK.Definition: the fact that something is not available or that there is not enough of it

LOGO.Definition: a design or symbol used by a company to advertise its products

MIDDLEMAN.Definition: a person who buys goods from the company that has produced them and makes a profit by selling them to a shop or a user

MONITOR.Definition: to watch and check a situation carefully for a period of time in order to discover something about it

NEGOTIATING.Definition: to have formal discussions with someone in order to reach an agreement with them

NUMB.Definition: If a part of your body is numb, you are unable to feel it, usually for a short time; not able to feel any emotions or to think clearly, because you are so shocked or frightened, et

OVERHEADS.Definition: the regular and necessary costs, such as rent and heating, that are involved in operating a business

OVERSIGHT.Definition: responsibility for a job or activity and for making sure it is being done correctly

PRECARIOUS.Definition: in a dangerous state because of not being safe or not being held in place firmly

PREMIUM.Definition: an amount that is more than usual

RETAILERS.Definition: a person, shop, or business that sells goods to the public

ROSY.Definition: If a situation is described as rosy, it gives hope of success or happiness

SALARIES.Definition: a fixed amount of money agreed every year as pay for an employee, usually paid directly into his or her bank account every month

SCANDALS.Definition: (an action or event that causes) a public feeling of shock and strong moral disapproval

SCEPTICAL.Definition: doubting that something is true or useful

SO-CALLED.Definition: used to show that you think a word that is used to describe someone or something is not suitable or not correct

STABLE.Definition: firmly fixed or not likely to move or change

STAMP.Definition: a tool for putting a mark on an object either by printing on it or pushing into it, or the mark made in this way

SUPPLY CHAIN.Definition: the system of people and things that are involved in getting a product from the place where it is made to the person who buys it

SUPPOSEDLY.Definition: used to show that you do not believe that something you have been told is true

TENDED.Definition: to be likely to behave in a particular way or have a particular characteristic

TERM.Definition: a word or expression used in relation to a particular subject, often to describe something official or technical

TERMS.Definition: words or expressions used in relation to a particular subject, often to describe something official or technical

TERMS OF TRADE.Definition: the agreements of trade between two parties

VOLATILE.Definition: likely to change suddenly and unexpectedly, especially by getting worse

WELL.Definition: a deep hole in the ground from which you can get water, oil, or gas
